result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final Pre-Trial set for 01/13/23 and Jury Trial 12 Person set for 01/25/23 - moved, left no address

10:10 AM Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Zjoran A. Hinton.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dodge calls the case and states the appearances. 
Court questions where Mr. Hinton is for this hearing. 
Atty Lloyd states that Mr. Hinton had a revocation hearing scheduled for this morning. 

Court questions if trial is being scheduled for this case.
Atty Lloyd states that it is correct.
Atty Dodge states that two days will be needed for trial.
Atty Lloyd agrees. 

Any substantive motions to be filed by November 1st. 
Court questions discovery being sent out.
Atty Dodge believes that it has all gone out.
Atty Lloyd believes he has received all discovery. 

All discovery to go out by October 21st.
Letters to be filed by parties on this date.

Motions in limine, jury instructions, and witness lists to be filed by December 1st. 

State has complied with victim rights legislation.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in court, in custody.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by video for Zjoran A. Hinton.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

9:04 AM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Atty Lloyd can see and hear everything in the courtroom.
Court advises Defendant regarding if at any time, he wants to talk to his attorney, Court will take a break. 

This is the date and time set for a continuation of the motion hearing but more for an oral ruling but wants to give counsel any final arguments.
Court reviews the last hearing. 
Court did review the squad video, at least the first few minutes of the stop.

Atty Dodge continues to rely on the brief and the testimony of Deputy Selvey.

Atty Lloyd continues to rely on the documents that were submitted at the first hearing.

Court addresses the Court, states facts for the record, gives oral ruling.
341.15 is referred to.
State vs. Houghton 364wis 2nd 234 is referred to. 392us1 is referred to. 468us420 is referred to. 517us806 is referred to. 

BY THE COURT:
Motion to Suppress is denied. 

Pretrial conference will need to be set. 

9:30 AM Matter is adjourned.

Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in court, in custody.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for Zjoran A. Hinton.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
1:33 PM Exhibit #1 and Exhibit #2 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff prior to the case being called. 

1:41 PM Court calls the case.
Atty Dodge states the appearances. 
This is a motion hearing for the defendant's motion for suppression.

1:42 PM Atty Dodge calls Deputy Connor Selvey.
Deputy Selvey is sworn in by the Clerk.
Direct exam by Atty Dodge. 

1:49 PM Atty Dodge approaches the witness stand and gives exhibit #1 to Deputy Selvey for review. 
Exhibit #1 is referenced to during direct exam.

1:50 PM Atty Dodge asks to move exhibit #1 into evidence.
No objection by Atty Lloyd.
Court receives exhibit #1. 
Atty Dodge gives exhibit #2 to Deputy Selvey for review.
Exhibit #2 is referenced to during direct exam.
Atty Dodge asks to move exhibit #2 into evidence.
No objection by Atty Lloyd.
Court receives exhibit #2.

1:55 PM Cross exam by Atty Lloyd. 

1:57 PM Court questions Deputy Selvey.

2:01 PM Court references exhibit #2 during questioning. 
No further questioning from Atty Dodge or Atty Lloyd. 

Court questions if both parties have reviewed the squad video.
Atty Dodge and Atty Lloyd have no objection to the Court reviewing the squad video.

BY THE COURT: State to provide the court with a flash drive within the next couple of days. 

Atty Lloyd does not believe he will be filing a brief.
Atty Dodge makes statements in regards to a brief.

BY THE COURT: Zoom appearance is approved for Atty Lloyd and Mr. Hinton for the next hearing. 

Atty Dodge will have the flash drive for the court by tomorrow morning at the latest.

BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Larry Lloyd appointed
Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Do not possess any firearms

1:02 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Felon in Possession of a Firearm, Possession of Controlled Substances, Battery to Law Enforcement or Correctional Officer  and Resisting. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.

State requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record for objection and would request a signature bond.
Court does believe that some cash is necessary and will set a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   02/14/2022 @ 1:15 p.m.  in Branch 2.
